subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Lakota voice---maybe?
author: Rhonda W
full_text:
--0-1083029935-1205799361=:24678
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

ya thats kinda why Im curious as to where it was recorded...theres some small Lakhota radio stations out there that its possible it came from one of them.  But am curious to know if its their language or not...sounds like it...Tonka I believe is buffalo...but I think it can be a different word depending on whats used before the word and after.
   
  Rhonda

Lisby <lisby@...> wrote:
          I hear it, but I can't tell if it's a radio frag  or not.  

  Ann
  
    On Mar 17, 2008, at 12:56 AM, Frank Sumption wrote:

       In the middle is a voice that sounds Lakota, or Souix, "....Haut(hot)-Wu-Tonka..." Any guesses? This is from the Ghostman, last month. It pays to go over the recordings more than once. 
 
 Frank-S
